restoreShortcut.content: After removing any quick access link, you can restore it from the notification that pops up.

performance.title: Interface lag or stuttering, high CPU/GPU usage

content.item1: Disable unnecessary effects in the performance settings (do not enable blur effects when using video wallpapers)

chromeFooter.title: How to hide the footer at the bottom of Chrome's new tab page?

content.reason: This is because Google has placed all "Customize Chrome" related features in the sidebar, and the entry point for this sidebar is only on the new tab page.
content.step: You can first click the "Customize Chrome" button in the lower right corner to open the sidebar, then scroll to the bottom of the page, and turn off "Show footer on the 'New Tab' page" in the footer section.

content.intro: On some Windows devices with Intel integrated graphics, Chromium-based browsers may freeze on startup. Try the following solutions:
content.step1: Update graphics driver: Make sure your graphics driver is up to date.

step2.text: On the Experiments (chrome://flags) page, change {code1} to {code2}
